meanings.definition: Able to be kept or retained.
meanings.sent1: The old toy was so keepable that it stayed in good condition for years.
meanings.sent2: The fresh fruit is very keepable and will last a long time in the fridge.
meanings.sent3: The keepable cookie jar seemed to magically refill itself every night.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a keepable treasure, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The keepable secret was finally revealed at the surprise party.

meanings.definition: Suitable for being kept or preserved.
meanings.sent1: The keepable documents were safely stored in the filing cabinet.
meanings.sent2: The antique vase was fragile but surprisingly keepable in the display case.
meanings.sent3: The keepable recipe book was filled with delicious family traditions.
meanings.sent4: His memories were like keepable snapshots in the album of his mind.
meanings.sent5: The keepable heirloom was passed down through generations with care.
